column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: catbel228, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been on Metrogel for about ten days, but so far, so good.  I've so far noticed a decrease in redness and my skin feels much smoother and far less "angry-looking." I use it at night, with Finacea in the morning. My dermatologist also recommended using only Dove Free soap to wash with, and salt/cool water soaks for five minutes two times per day, which is actually very soothing. I've had this problem for so long, thought it was just acne, so I've been attacking it with every product I could find, which was only making my skin worse, more irritated and horrible-looking - I'm so glad I finally made that appt. and read your reviews - they were very helpful and encouraging!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just developed acne rosacea a month and a half ago after extreme stress and tanning. Once I started using metrogel and stopped tanning, the redness went away in less than a week. I still have tiny little pimples and whiteheads though that have not reduced much at all. I never had these before and I hate them! My derm. prescribed it once a day w/ Oracea (oral antibiotic) and I'm still doing both. I am increasing the metrogel to twice a day now to see if I see improvement. My stress level has not reduced much and I notice flares of the acne and redness when I have a particularly stressful event. When I do have redness I use Eucerin redness relief moisturizer that is green tinted and it works wonders!!

column2: LL Cool J, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Oddly, I began using this medication after my mother passed away (it was her RX).  I had a red, raw rash beneath my breasts that I assumed was sweat/irritation related (and I am fairly flat-chested).  My dermatologist gave me several different salve samples to try, but nothing seemed to work.  Out of frustration, I began using the Metrogel 1%; EUREKA!!  I can't believe how quickly the rash/redness/soreness disappeared (after 1 week's usage).  I know this RX was for mom's roseacea, but it certainly worked on my rash!

column2: Karen2be, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from acne since my teen years  it seemed to get worse with age! I was given this gel many years ago and didn't give it a fair chance..you must be consistent! It has worked wonders and no boils even! Always had boils before that time of month..and not now! 15+ years of tetracycline and this is much beter! I will be 40 soon and finally free of acne! I apply three times a day and only have slight dryness..that's great because I am usually so oily! I still have scars from the boils but they are getting better now.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have sebhoreic dermatitus on my face, not rosascea, but this was prescribed to me anyway. I have been using this in conjunction with Clenia and washing my face more often than before. My face improved dramatically, but I cant be sure which of those three things is what did it most.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this medication during the winter and I notice that my skin has gotten very dry. Using a light mosturizer like Cetaphil afterwards helps with the dryness.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: MetroGel seems to have cured my rosacea.  I had incredibly painful tiny white heads covering the apples of my cheeks coupled with sore redness that was actually hot to the touch.I used MetroGel 2X a day religiously for about a month.  My skin got a little dry and flaky, but when I decreased my usage and the flakes came off, it was like I had new skin!  I still have pink cheeks from having had rosacea for so long (I think some of the capillaries are busted) but my skin is in great shape.  I now use MetroGel about once a week mixed in with a little bit of my night time moisturizer.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with acne rosacea about three months ago. Metrogel lotion is easy enough to use but in 12 weeks my skin is just as bad, if not worse. My skin is oily and using Metrogel seems to make that even worse as well.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: john, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i have various types of acne and blacheads. acne rosacia left some bumps on my nose.there were enlarging pores and a lot ot of blackheads especially on my nose. metrogel used 2-3 times daily have reduced pores and redness. even the funny bumps are diminishing.  i recommend metrogel.

column2: eire923, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: In my 30's I was suddenly facing acne-like facial breakouts along with facial redness.  I was perplexed and thought I was dealing with a make-up allergy!  Even my doctor diagnosed me with adult acne and gave me an oral antibiotic.  One day a friend asked me if I had Rosacea--I had never heard of it.  I went to my doctor with this information and was prescribedMetrogel/or Metrocream, coupled with an oral antibiotic to take for the first month and with any subsequent flares.  It has been almost 15 years and the severe symptoms have never returned.  I use the cream, because it seems to work better for me--I swear by it and don't let a day go by without using it at least once a day, sometimes twice.  It's fabulous!

column2: piratedig67, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: if you have roscea stay out of the sun

column2: Beautiful, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from rosacea for almost 30 years. I felt I looked awful and had to cover my skin with thick makeup. I was finally given this by a new dermatologist (in addition to an oral antibiotic for the first 60 days). I used this at night (and use Finacea in the morning). I have seen a 95% improvement in my skin after about 2 1/2 to 3 months. I am now comofrtable going makeup-free and still feel I look great! In fact, I have been told by many people that I look 10 years younger than I am...I work in a beauty store, of all places.Don't stop using your rx unless your derma tells you to! It can take time to see results.

column2: belinda, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After being misdiagnosed for 7 years, I had almost given up hope. But Metro Gel has changed my lifr. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it took four years to find a diagnosis and treatment for what my new doctor says is rosacea. She prescribed Metro-gel cream .75% plus duflican 100 mg (anti-fungal) I promise you, I began to see results the next day. No itching or burning with this cream. Doctor said it would take 3 weeks to see results. But not me, I saw them immediately.

column2: daowens, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Rosacea 4 weeks ago. I had painful pimples all over my face. I have to continue using Metrogel daily.
